creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
In src/modules/xhtml/samples/xhtml.xml, the title element is empty. This is then
collapsed into minimized form when being output. This is illegal in XHTML and is
causing issues with FCKeditor under IE 6. I am unsure of the best solution.
Sticking something in there to prevent the collapse, like &#160, or to remove
it. If title is removed, head also must be removed as that will collapse without
title being present.

creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
Okay, removal doesn't work. Something puts the tags back in, and they get
collapsed down to an empty element, which is not legal. And if I'm reading the
XHTML spec correctly, a head element is required and heads require titles. So,
therefore we need something in there to prevent the title from collapsing. I
tried &#160 but that is converted into an odd character upon saving. However,
since this should never be displayed, I don't know if that is an issue.

Can't figure out a way to insert something that will be invisible yet persist.
This is needed so that documents edited with FCKeditor under IE work properly.
The title element is never used for anything other than validation, so there
should be no issue.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 19024
Adds title to prevent collapse of title element
